data.title: Believe Me, If All Those Endearing Young Charms, by Thomas Moore
data.meta_description:
Believe me, if all those endearing…
Which I gaze on so fondly to-day,
Were to change by to-morrow, and f…
Like fairy-gifts, fading away!
Thou wouldst still be ador'd as th…
data.text:
Sail on, sail on, thou fearless ba… Where’er blows the welcome wind, It cannot lead to scenes more dark… More sad than those we leave behin… Each wave that passes seems to say…

Forget not the field where they pe… The truest, the last of the brave, All gone —and the bright hope we c… Gone with them, and quench’d in th… Oh! could we from death but recove…

They came from a land beyond the s… And now o’er the western main Set sail, in their good ships, gal… From the sunny land of Spain. “Oh, where’s the isle we’ve seen i…

A Donkey, whose talent for burden… So much that you’d swear he rejoic… One day had to jog under panniers… That —down the poor Donkey fell s… His owners and drivers stood round…

Oh, where’s the slave so lowly, Condemn’d to chains unholy, Who, could he burst His bonds at first, Would pine beneath them slowly?

As slow our ship her foamy track Against the wind was cleaving, Her trembling pennant still look’d… To that dear isle 'twas leaving. So loath we part from all we love,

You remember Ellen, our hamlet’s… How meekly she bless’d her humble… When the stranger, William, had m… And love was the light of their lo… Together they toil’d through winds…

Take your bell, take your bell, Good Crier, and tell To the Bulls and the Bears, till… That, lost or stolen, Or fall’n through a hole in

Go then, if she, whose shade thou… No more will let thee soothe my pa… Yet, tell her, it has cost this he… Some pangs, to give thee back agai… Tell her, the smile was not so dea…

Come, send round the wine, and lea… To simpleton sages and reasoning f… This moment’s a flower too fair an… To be wither’d and stain’d by the… Your glass may be purple, and mine…

'Twas grav’d on the Stone of Dest… In letters four, and letters three… And ne’er did the King of the Gul… But those awful letters scar’d his… For he knew that a Prophet Voice…

Oh! the days are gone, when Beaut… My heart’s chain wove; When my dream of life, from morn t… Was love, still love. New hope may bloom,

As vanquish’d Erin wept beside The Boyne’s ill—fated river, She saw where Discord, in the tid… Had dropp’d his loaded quiver. “Lie hid,” she cried, “ye venom’d…

Go where glory waits thee, But while fame elates thee, Oh! still remember me. When the praise thou meetest To thine ear is sweetest,
